intro: Psychotria leiocarpa f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, angular stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers with two lobes, typically arranged in clusters. Its fruits are small, globose berries that turn red when mature. This species is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded forest understories.
